channel.title: Proposing a standard for the logo of the Black Mesa Research Facility
channel.description:
Fellow citizens!
Inspired by inconsistencies of official Black Mesa Research Facility logos and their fan-made counterparts, I am proposing a standard to the community which will allow every member to easily create a decent Black Mesa Research Facility logo in vector or raster format that will very closely resemble Valve's official logos.
In other words, this is done to avoid abominations such as this one:
[img]https://3.bp.blogspot.com/_xgfGhW_izn4/SigK6UQHptI/AAAAAAAAAIs/a3_Qf6kupDs/s400/black_mesa_symbol_spray_.png[/img]
So, here it is. It is based on the BMRF logos found in the files of Half-Life, Half-Life 2 and Half-Life: Episode Two. I've spent some time comparing and averaging different versions and came to the conclusion that these are the optimal dimensions for creating a BMRF logo.
[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/u/2044596/Black_Mesa/bmrf_logo_standard_0-4-0-0.png[/img]
The height of 50 units of the facility's "roof" in the logo is influenced by the latest available official logo (lobby from EP2) - all other (older) logos have a height of about 52 units. The width of outer circle (8 units) is also from the EP2 logo, older logos have the width of about 9 units.
The slope, however, has a minor difference compared to EP2 and resembles more to the logo on Alyx's sweater in Half-Life 2 than the logo from EP2. I was going to explain why, but this post is tl;dr enough as it is.
Result: [img]https://dl.dropbox.com/u/2044596/Black_Mesa/bmrf_logo_standard_0-4-0-0_completed_white.png[/img]
Note: the standard is not complete and is subject to changes.

item.title: Proposing a standard for the logo of the Black Mesa Research Facility
item.dc:creator: Andy0103
item.description:
Maverix26:

This is just one of those few threads that has just a little more positive posts, and feedback(: Andy, this is some really amazing work!

BTW why does it say you’re banned?

Thank you very much for support!

I made a joke about the Anonymous, Rabid took it too seriously and permabanned me. No hard feelings, he was probably just angry because of the leak and needed to take out on someone. :3

item.title: Proposing a standard for the logo of the Black Mesa Research Facility
item.dc:creator: Andy0103
item.description:
Here is the improved diagram:

larger version

I can provide a SVG version of diagram, BMRF logo and BM mod logo (modified to comply with the standard) if someone needs them.

We need to post this on another HL-related forums too if we want it to become widely used. But for now I want to hear your input.

Read full topic

item.title: Proposing a standard for the logo of the Black Mesa Research Facility
item.dc:creator: James.Curse
item.description:
Andy0101:

Unfortunately, no. See here.

But it’s not hard to combine them:

No problem. I just added a few rectangles in Inkscape and C/P-ed HEX value from Argentinian flag.

I don’t think I could make a Lambda standard. The angles and lengths are weird and it’s impossible to snap them into a grid while maintaining resemblance to the original Lambda. It’s probably best to just export the A character from HalfLife2.ttf into various formats so it is easily accessible to anyone who needs it, which I will do tomorrow 'cus I’m tired (it’s 2: 30 AM).

λdam:

I took the liberty of adding the background for you, but of course the credit still goes to Andy. :3

Andy0101:

Fix’d

But the frame remains…

BEST INTERNET COMMUNITY EVER

Really guys, you are all great. Thanks a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: Proposing a standard for the logo of the Black Mesa Research Facility
item.dc:creator: Andy0101
item.description:
Harry-UK:

Ah, sorry for the confusion, but when I asked “Is the actual BM logo up to this standard?” I meant the logo the mod uses around the website.

Unfortunately, no. See here.

But it’s not hard to combine them:

James.Curse:

Hey, thanks!!! :awesome:
Really, thanks a lot

No problem. I just added a few rectangles in Inkscape and C/P-ed HEX value from Argentinian flag.

I don’t think I could make a Lambda standard. The angles and lengths are weird and it’s impossible to snap them into a grid while maintaining resemblance to the original Lambda. It’s probably best to just export the A character from HalfLife2.ttf into various formats so it is easily accessible to anyone who needs it, which I will do tomorrow 'cus I’m tired (it’s 2: 30 AM).

Read full topic
